document.title: South Dakota Oceti Sakowin Essential Understandings & Standards

64E0AAB4BCD64836923B2AC825992798.description: Research and explain the role of Oceti Sakowin societies within traditional social structure (i.e. warrior societies, law enforcement, accomplished artisans, etc.)

AB3F2E9D29104D3BA02CC4A8E5075525.description: Identify themes and concepts presented in Oceti Sakowin oral traditions (i.e. behaviors in Iktomi stories, etc.)

8423140AC119428C809250322DC8C265.description: Share a personal experience that exhibits each value of the Oceti Sakowin

97241412E7A64499B85F79AB0F5766C4.description: Create a personalized tipi or parfleche

2A48ACF913FA43E28C418C0F7C3EC9C8.description: Reflect on an Iktomi (spider/the trickster) story

8CE1272196EE442E97F672FBABB8D90C.description: Students will identify ways that the Oceti Sakowin values provide resiliency in keeping the Oceti Sakowin way of life.

7DB1512F84064AFAA63DEF246641F69E.description: Identify, research, and present (i.e. PowerPoint presentation, report, film, etc.) on racial stereotypes, fallacies, and misconceptions versus reality (i.e. myths vs. truths)

05233761347E4F57BFD6ED63D68B4866.description: Research contemporary tribal people who have made or are making an impact and positive change within their community or state

0C5E87B15D2B425D807C466A2CCD6F67.description: Compare and contrast the differences and similarities of tribal colleges and mainstream colleges and universities

98776B3E2492439A82D04E22FA2C2A82.description: Investigate a contemporary issue (i.e. social, environmental, etc.) and explain the response of Oceti Sakowin individuals and communities

2327CC9F6F5B4342A2E3F0CD05A1A039.description: Trace a student's personal development over time and identify similarities to changes within Oceti Sakowin communities

81A4B59507FF4204BF3CA3B888EC4A03.description: Examine and describe actions taken by Oceti Sakowin individuals and communities that bring about social change.

809DD7763D634A90A98F3BCF82D6A855.description: Construct timelines, linear and/or cyclical, with explanation of the impact of events that created change beginning with the Self Determination Era

158B95258543475FA96A5684C99EE894.description: Write a 5 paragraph essay on the American Indian Movement and events that led up to the occupation of Wounded Knee

7223D15D0DF94BC7AAD4C24D767B3F3B.description: Research and document how personal rights are incorporated in self-determination

AB73D417A6F14602BAF00192824CA90C.description: Share a personal experience that exhibited the values of courage and/or fortitude

77FB321AF0DB427581B80627CD7DE376.description: Define resiliency and how it is present in nature (i.e. adaptation of plants and animals to changes over time)

A3073807A09B40DCBC20096B48A005C7.description: Create classroom rules that promote student self-determination

0F671FD77FF64017B70B6953764B1AD1.description: Identify policies that were established during the self-determination era which created a change for tribal communities and reinforced the essential philosophy of the Oceti Sakowin, demonstrating resiliency.

59A23C7DD9FA43F89A1755B06E7DCABA.description:
Explain the causes and effects of the termination time periods 1945-1961 and Self Determination Era 1961-Present time periods of the Oceti Sakowin
  • Termination- Public Law 280 of 1953
  • Indian Relocation Act of 1956
  • Native American Civil Rights of 1968
  • American Indian Religious Freedom Act of 1970
  • Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978
  • Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975
  • Indian Gaming Regulatory Act of 1988
  • Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act of 1990
  • Black Hills Land Claim 1980

A80AA38A053947FD907B083EEF21F256.description: Discuss how Tribal governments, health services, schools, casinos, Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) and Bureau of Indian Education were affected by legislation and Acts

3F11DBA2A3B14335A8CFFEFAB0CDB1B0.description: Identify the contemporary infrastructure of the Oceti Sakowin tribal communities (ex: Tribal government headquarters/agencies, Tribal businesses, Tribal programs & compare/contrast to off-reservation community)

B01834280B284E6CA602246B6D3B0AF8.description: Create a map/color a map of community services

9A50918536EB40E2A5333BA9585A1D51.description: Demonstrate an understanding of how Oceti Sakowin tribal governments participate differently with state(s) and the federal government (historically to the present).

8FD39A40C59D4A32967DC3CC58640159.description:
Analyze the causes and effects of the reorganization and self-government periods of the Oceti Sakowin
  • Indian Citizen Act of 1924
  • Pick-Sloan Act of 1944
  • Indian Removal Act of 1930
  • New Deal Act/Indian Reorganization Act/Howard Wheeler Act of 1934

183427A4A4CA43E0BE0CDC46B7F12D67.description:
Explain and construct a timeline of the following Federal Acts
  • Pick-Sloan Act of 1944
  • Indian Removal Act of 1930
  • Research Indian Citizen Act of 1924, Public Law 280, New Deal Act/Indian Reorganization Act/Howard Wheeler Act of 1934

005859CC92944A79A54FD88FD375E0B0.description: Describe the Reorganization and Self- Governance time period of the Oceti Sakowin people (1928-1945).

8CB58F12500049BBB0CD662E33443672.description: Research the American Indian Religious Freedom Act (AIRFA- 1978) Research how this has impacted ceremonial practices of the Oceti Sakowin people.

7262A6721EED40E4B4603957C8180B5E.description: Read, discuss and report on books and novels by Native American Renaissance writers.

BCBB727DFA924F528790B5EDC054AE98.description: Explore data on the loss of Indigenous languages during this time period.

AC937B955AC3448197D7FF95E57E913F.description: Watch and discuss Native Elder interviews concerning boarding school experiences.

4B0B1E72007D4D2D936D1C570B02D9F8.description: Research and report on the US Boarding School project supported by the US government with the goal of "Killing the Indian to Save the Man."

3DACF6D17F154AD7B60CEB29754744C1.description: Identify and describe the impacts of US assimilation policies and programs on Oceti Sakowin people in education, language, culture civil rights & spiritual practice. (1887-1978).

2418A3EB7072460BBE70F362B91D4816.description:
Analyze the cause and effect on loss of cultural identity of the Oceti Sakowin by researching the following periods of US government encroachment including but not limited to:
  • Indian Removal Act 1830
  • Colonization Period 1850
  • Minnesota-Dakota War 1862
  • Treaty Period 1805-1871
  • Boarding Schools 1879-1968
  • Major Crimes 1885
  • Allotment Period/Dawes Act 1887
  • Wounded Knee 1890

EFFC51C247494C49ACF6C1B6D0687DF4.description: Research/report the boarding school history as it pertains to Oceti Sakowin

226AB06760BE4B56985BDECF1198D021.description: On a map, label and identify relocation routes of the Oceti Sakowin (1828-1887)

B58B0A1F706E4751AEB4FD3B660E055B.description: Analyze and define the historic and contemporary effects of US Removal and Relocation era policies on Oceti Sakowin people (1828-1887).

DF42A1B5AF1441DF809A17343CFBC913.description: Select one treaty from 1851-1868 and interpret the issues arising from Manifest Destiny

0CC80338846745F994DA235F70C3088A.description: Develop an essay on the effects of treaty rights violation on the Oceti Sakowin

F3EA31A95D4E4D4CA612C1FAEC7E401E.description: Divide a classroom into two groups and design a simulation of the treaty making process. Topics include land, trade, and laws

90612D8CBC7B4CB9A68BBC13473D847D.description: Create classroom/playground rules using negotiation and compromise

36EB460095564C1AB56694CCD8AC7E75.description: Describe how Oceti Sakowin land stewardship was impacted through the process of treaty-making and land ownership (1532-1828).

D2D2987DE3584A2ABE07C845C3B0E139.description: Find facts that are recorded in Winter Counts, and not in history books, and then describe the accuracy of the events (connected to Understanding 5)

A44B80345AC347FD992DCE956C6B2DA8.description: Compare events recorded on Winter Counts to dates in American history

9C9DB0080ECE4ECD8E5D8FAFEBD24317.description: Create a classroom (large group) Winter Count by choosing important activities throughout the year to portray (by consensus to add an event to the Winter Count)

644C89C512E044EA915A36658E7D633E.description: Identify and describe Winter Counts, petroglyphs, and shirt wearer's shirts (war shirt)

B359757A3B3A4600A9EB87A5507F4B02.description: Identify historic eras as recorded through Oceti Sakowin Winter Counts, petroglyphs, and shirt wearer's shirts (1700-1870).

A7D9C89EB42B450CBAD7D75684EBE156.description: Compare and contrast the evolution of written traditions within the three cultures (woodlands, prairie, and plains) of the Oceti Sakowin

A108BB3735E148BAB918C451BCB95C3B.description: Create a diagram depicting the annual camp circle of the Oceti Sakowin bands in their assigned locations

C40010FF580B460A88965A73B57B5862.description: Create a diorama that represents the woodland, prairie, and plains cultures

990C76062288414FBD51B1FAC8581A3B.description: Compare the diverse cultures (woodlands, prairie, and plains) within the Oceti Sakowin through oral tradition and written accounts.

6B21D1DDEB444871B8876F44F39B7660.description: Research and demonstrate the role of interpreters between tribes and government officials (i.e. Fort Laramie Treaty, etc.)

A5C319DF17584175BADDE5E73C77A038.description: Compare and contrast the different views of General Harney, Lewis and Clark and George Catlin

20ACBAD4ADE247A7BC6643F5820490A3.description: Write a 5 paragraph essay about Manifest Destiny and Colonialism.

66F804CB0DE448AC8C41CA4D8DF4019C.description: Create a chart that illustrates the names of sites that have both Oceti Sakowin and English names

9024921D8B2542DABA9F59557C8469C2.description: Read Home to Medicine Mountain by Chiori Santiago and reflect on life during and after boarding schools

8D02DA1DF9854775A1CA77CA385E2122.description: Understand and evaluate the impact of Colonialism and Manifest Destiny on the historic and contemporary culture of Oceti Sakowin people.

C31FF161FC3C405FA9EAC20A01F8C972.description: Read The Lakota Way: Stories & Lessons for Living by Joseph Marshall and reflect on its implications within the student's lives

8D0DAF600F6B4F5BBD162D93E4F7854F.description: Compare and contrast Oceti Sakowin accounts and mainstream historical accounts of events (i.e. Battle of the Little Bighorn, treaty-making, etc.)

55CD07B9A4EA443FAA4EEC3D0FB817BE.description: Reflect and create a visual demonstration of an oral tradition (i.e. film trailer, presentation, painting, etc.)

CFDC8865912C4ADBA4FA8625E94964AD.description: Create a personal winter count (i.e. life, summer activities, etc.)

365AA2B14F964888856395E3BB426D30.description: Identify elements of Oceti Sakowin culture within oral tradition, written accounts and primary source information, and compare them to written accounts by mainstream historians.

FAD5E36C790740D58D166CA36E0B9967.description: Create a three act play, song, TV commercial, or write an Iktomi story demonstrating how a society is cohesive

BC0CD05F64484C2198A67B2488804261.description: Compare/contrast Euro-American values to Oceti Sakowin values and report on your findings

E8D8BF3AFEBE4D8EBCFEFC0554070C20.description: Explore the concepts and explain the model individual roles and how personal action affects the Tiwahe

73B73D19777E462EBDB7D6D6AE6A33F1.description: Read and discuss The Lakota Way: Stories and Lessons for Living, Joseph Marshall III

C26194EDC0D14BE88AB2FACAE018F83C.description: Read and discuss Iktomi stories that discourage inappropriate behavior and discuss what was inappropriate and what could make that behavior better

3BB476A246EB41A481A0038FDFF5D63A.description: Role play for proper greetings and respectful greeting

B4E1F82067F7426B9515D6D16B3256C7.description: Describe the traditional behavior patterns, codes of respect and values promoted within the Oceti Sakowin tiospaye.

61A46C37714A4DE89C9567857A2A3FA9.description: Research and report traditional child rearing practices and walking in a sacred manner

555F99EC4C874201936ACEA7B0C6BAC6.description: Invite a speaker to present on male/female rites of passage/discuss

69C240D0D18C43378A87C53576D8F8BD.description: Explain the extended family structure through blood, marriages and adoption

360F6D9A14F4488FB1D73811E596E8C3.description: Research and record family tree and explore how relationships are made

B91AD67A8D0544DBB60C0A5B38D423CB.description: Read and discuss Home of the Nomadic Buffalo Hunters, by Paul Goble

EDE2516BDB224CD1AB0161651D2F538A.description: Draw 2 pictures- 1) Illustrate a family picture (their own) and discuss each person's role in the family, 2) Illustrate a picture of the traditional Oceti Sakowin family and discuss each person's role; discuss similarities/differences between the two pictures

5D6D71DEDC5F4548A463234EC78E8362.description: Compare and contrast the traditional Oceti Sakowin family structure to contemporary family structures.

2F31F67E86D447E1B4DF283BAE9D7A98.description: Research and create another Context Chart of other Oceti Sakowin songs.

175CCA3DE2494E9BA051A81D13C3B77A.description: Organize the 8 songs in the OSEUS document into a contextualized chart that includes 1) celebration/honoring, 2) ceremony, and 3) powwow (wacipi).

841D52CF54084B9FAC70E3EE334A49B2.description: Identify Oceti Sakowin songs and categorize them by appropriate context (ceremony songs, honoring/celebration songs, and wacipi/ powwow songs).

B72F69BB59C44774918A5B2473AC2143.description: Read the story The Great Race of the Birds and Animals by Paul Goble, and have students draw a picture from the story (Suggestion- do not let students see the illustrations as you read the story. That way students come up with their own picture ideas)

2753422FB48B425396DE211423CDDC29.description: Recall Oceti Sakowin sacred sites, creation stories, and star knowledge and describe how they relate to each other, and how they are still used today on and off the reservation.

64FAA2CD12434BE7B1F7845BF832CC51.description: Read the introduction of Reading and Writing the Lakota Language by Albert White Hat Sr. and create a timeline based on influences and changes to Oceti Sakowin languages over time

24A7DD460A5144889E002880C4EBF2E6.description: Create a Lakota/Dakota/Nakota word, referring to standard Lakota dictionaries and the Dictionary of Modern Lakota by Edward Starr (add The Dictionary of Modern Lakota by Edward Starr to resources)

CDDD0FD4AF8943E7B7A9B735AF278DA7.description: Investigate and report on educational efforts to revitalize Oceti Sakowin languages (i.e. collegiate, immersion schools, etc.)

B44E356E97B849A98CC4671BE1F2CC17.description: Develop a dictionary of contemporary words and phrases. Who uses these words/phrases that we are coming up with? Us today? Past lingo? (i.e. slang, text message language, etc.)

ABB7E23CAF5747A1A597453834F9A8E7.description: Research names, English and Lakota/Dakota/Nakota, of Oceti Sakowin leaders and describe the meanings and origins of those names

C2EDD92840634DD59A74719E2DDCA5C8.description: Create a poster illustrating the meaning of the student's name

75A24A904076458A8A00604A423B25D6.description: Describe efforts made by tribal members on and off the reservation to revitalize Oceti Sakowin languages.

D65CB49A216A4F41A953A766B497C0E1.description: Identify the dialect(s) and sub-dialect(s) spoken on contemporary reservations

E60A3F2B3BA44D64BE66701327B6F6C0.description: Identify where the student's community would be located at the annual camp circle of the Oceti Sakowin and the dialect spoken by that community

7A56B06100194880BEF60B47B172C59A.description: Create a diagram depicting the annual camp circle of the Oceti Sakowin bands in their assigned locations

FE419CFCE4C146E68EF2A56DC1747C05.description: Develop a poster of Oceti Sakowin and name each band and dialects

163E845CB68A46B1B73EDDD70D010050.description: Read Home to Medicine Mountain by Chiori Santiago and reflect on the impact of boarding schools on the Oceti Sakowin languages

6C7FD1B6F7384284B8DCC8D507FF6992.description: Identify similarities and differences among the Lakota/Dakota/Nakota language dialects.

0D0F75E031024CBC9FF994EF004D4866.description: Research 1968 Native American Bill of Rights

321022A955934D84856800B038F58484.description: Create a "What ifscenario- What would the Black Hills have been like had treaties NOT been signed?"

2D7021C038D44789A695BE389C50C9EE.description: Create a "Black Hills Are Not For Sale" proposal

91DAFC38DC8D4308B725F3BFDE5C3B5B.description: Discuss Oceti Sakowin treaties and Euro-American treaties

3F9071625A2349149597F45CEB0EC107.description: Research the various treaties between the Oceti Sakowin and United States

BB0B0E1F17384926A6379E5184074CAF.description: Recognize that there is a continuum of tribal identity, ranging from assimilated to traditional lifestyle, that includes each unique subculture or individual member within the Oceti Sakowin.

7B024B5F7FED4187B9B93D0114876739.description: Simulate assimilation experiences, including: conversion of groups to individualism

E165EBD708A24124BC40875C10A79CCF.description: Discuss early Euro-American peoples and their stories (i.e. Irish).

7AFCA7A35BDD45A2990A84A4FAC4183B.description: Identify and describe the Concept of Tob Tob Kin and The Concept of One Out of Many, or Out of Many, One

713D0F0F565947C4BA06E2B8512871C2.description: Describe the impact of Euro-American ideals, values, rights, philosophy, and beliefs, upon Oceti Sakowin people as tribal, state, and US citizens.

36C6D72C9C5C4E50A735C3272CF644B7.description: Identify lifestyles of how each tribe evolved

A39937873D544C788960F41C583F58A1.description: Draw and create a representation of the Oceti Sakowin creation story

5817796B88FD4FBDB6585FC4BA4F37E6.description: Interview project with Elders, regarding spiritual, physical, social and emotional health

41CEC07F21144E9FBD96BBE2FF12D517.description: Identify Wolakota attributes, including: kinship systems, eight behavioral patterns, and codes of respect

89381C3DC23346D09FD7EEBB2EF7DACE.description: Interview an Elder or resource person, on one of the Oceti Sakowin origins stories

AD617EEBED15427192313F1DDA58D47B.description: Read and discuss Oceti Sakowin stories, such as Iktomi stories and historical lore stories

DB03AA79FE4B43D980DC3CD6D6FC5EC3.description: Create a medicine wheel, either Cangleska or Cangdeska

6B6EE9EE1C5C46FC97A1995E5DE856C8.description: Visualize and discuss a picture of their perspective on the Oceti Sakowin creation story. Have oral story tellers make presentations. Create a chronological order of story

BC16C684140146A6A9CD987FB8E2054B.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the Oceti Sakowin people's understanding of the interrelationship of spiritual, physical, social and emotional health.

1C92B93E73E74119B7B9BD14D0AD61FB.description: Study natural medicinal herbs and other indigenous plants on tribal lands

37D7EDA5E9B3451ABDC95435F3B74D65.description: Investigate and report on natural control

3EA71D166134408E9E17C0C5A2566D33.description: Investigate and report on tribal land management practices

744FCF1B339B44619BE0C4E3A5DEB9F1.description: Investigate and report on a water table in or along river systems and analyze the impact on tribal communities

EE9734A459A34CDC8548E9249EE1F2D4.description: Examine strategies the tribal governments and other tribal leaders are taking to improve the lands and natural gifts of Oceti Sakowin people.

B19D92C48F0A448D9590B9BCB8801B0E.description: Attend and participate in a science fair

21CD9D00F9F440B081991F4462C4F706.description: Investigate and report on tribal waste management projects

01EE1333DD71453A8EED565D00DCFAC5.description: Investigate and report on water project offices in tribal communities

D90A1A2910F24E1A90A3B6A281460877.description: Design and carry out recycling projects, planting projects or clean-up projects

8352163A8B6148969EC33E9FA01FE166.description: Identify and explain contemporary environmental issues facing Oceti Sakowin lands.

D2F477CB21D14641B4EE14AFB1BEE703.description: Construct diagrams or charts to show dialects, woodland lifestyle, plains lifestyle, governments, social systems, economics and resources

95F745FE9FCE47118EA6744364821F48.description: Create a brochure that shows Oceti Sakowin bands of the plains and woodland lifestyles

5FD389823E77422C972FE3A965445FB4.description: Research and report on the diversity of Oceti Sakowin such as language, lifestyle, economics and survival skills

22C25CCFC81C48A6A41E279F14301141.description: Demonstrate understanding of the interrelationships of Oceti Sakowin people, places, and environments within all tribal lands in South Dakota.

B5C1B7064D3A404A819EED496AF67D83.description: Create a chart showing how the physical geography of South Dakota lands, within and outside of reservation boundaries, have changed over time

1EC1E3EA50D0487C880B011BE110867C.description: Research and develop a report on communal ownership prior to European contact

CF036E7DD857490480BDDA9D6D0A318D.description: Create a compare and contrast map of Oceti Sakowin land lost from 1800-present day

663E44307C6B4179860B67A148F1E8B2.description: Describe traditional and contemporary Oceti Sakowin perspectives on communal stewardship of land and natural resources (flora, fauna, geographic and sacred features).

B8CEBA35602F4AE1AC51DD9D0228ACB7.description: Identify the reservation natural resources such as water, historic sites and other natural resources

4812DCEC46D74ABDA06004D93EE0C63D.description: Color a South Dakota map identifying reservations

3919EF155A2D45E398EF2588B8953701.description: Identify changes from the historic land base to the contemporary nine reservation South Dakota land base of the Oceti Sakowin, and analyze the causes and implication of those changes.
